It's been nearly a day after all.

I'm going to be looking at this all night, aren't I?
I'm gonna try not dwelling on it too much, ze.
[MARISA looks at the bookcases along the wall.]
Maybe I should switch the focus of this ol' shop over to bein' a library.

... Not sure if that four-eyes librarian in the village would appreciate having competition though.
I'd feel bad being her rival too, she's so nice... I'll just stick to magic I suppose.
[MARISA looks at the pile of papers on the floor]
I need ta figure out a better way ta store these old notes. Or I can just set 'em on fire, I guess.
A clear, moonlit night. Perfect for enjoying a warm glass of tea and staring at the stars for awhile...
Oh that's right, I'm supposed ta be making tea right now.
I should probably get on that, eh?
You just have ta appreciate the versatility of a good broom, don'tcha?
This ol' thing's gotten me out of many a pickle-- and it does a great job cleaning up the house too!
... When I remember ta clean up the house, that is.
[IF NO HAKKERO/HOJICHA: MARISA looks at the door]
I can't go outside yet, I don't have what I need.
I need a heat source and somethin' ta brew. Everything else is ready to go outside.

Oh, sweet, there it is! Nothing better for cookin' things fast.
The day I sleep in this thing will be the first one in a loooong time.
[MARISA looks at the chaise lounge in front of the window.]
Just looking at this chaise lounge makes me tired... *yawn*

I'll make sure ta put some wood in it so the house is nice and toasty when I get back inside though.
[MARISA looks at the shelf besides the fireplace]
Mmmm hojicha, there's just no other tea like it.
Smoky start with a hint of nut, but a sweet, caramel-y finish.
All that flavor, but still so light on the tongue. Love this stuff.
[IF MARISA HAS HAKKERO/HOJICHA: Marisa looks at the door]
Okay, got eveythin' I need. Now ta just enjoy this outside...
What a beautiful night. It's nice ta get out of the house and feel the fresh air sometimes...
... And ta not have ta smell the alchemy stuff any longer than I need ta.
All right, time for tea. Just a little spark and it's good ta go, ze.
Huh, that's not right. Guess I'll give it another go...
No way, this is happening. No way, no way, no way, da ze..
Damn it. This is the last thing I needed today.
... Come ta think of it, I haven't felt too good since I stepped outside...
What could possibly be goin' on , ze?
I'll go hunt down Reimu, maybe she'll know.
We're not on the best terms lately, but she'll help me if I ask nicely, right?
[MARISA goes inside to grab her broom, then comes back outside]
[SFX: Broom pounding the dirt and pavement]
You stupid piece of wood, DO SOMETHIN'!
Sitting around doin' nothin' ain't gonna help... I may as well look around and see if I can figure this out.
Hmm... There aren't any spores coming out of these puppies. This can't be the source of my troubles.
What is that expression, can't see the forest for the trees, ze?
Can't say I ever understood that one.
Anyway, don't think this is the cause of my troubles.
Maybe I should strip down and dive in ta see if I can shock the magic back into my system...
... Something is telling me now is not the time to do that.
No berries on this bush. Perhaps Minoriko came by and harvested them when I wasn't looking.
I should volunteer myself ta some of her homemade pie soon.
... Can't be thinking about that right now.
What a cute lil' sign! I wonder who made it, ehehe.
... Though it hasn't really drawn in any customers.
Maybe I need ta reconsider my commerical strategy.

Ce ușurare. I feared you might be one of those beings.

We're out in the middle of the bushes, that rustlin' could be anything.
I know well the forest. It was not part of us.
D'ya know what happened with the bridge?
Wha-- Nu, ascultă, the being is out there somewhere.
I care not about the bridge at present.
I can't help you without the bridge working.
I'm sorry if I snapped at you.
It matters not. We are in the same boat, then.

It's why I'm outside at present.
I was tryin' ta make tea, myself.
Would you not use fire to do that?
I've my tools for carpentry... I'm unsure how that'll help us get our powers back.
I've got my broom... That's even more useless.
Well... I guess we must drop the coin and figure it out ourselves.
(My lumber should be in the workshop. If Marisa has the rope...)
I shouldn't dally. We're both in trouble.

Maybe I should go into the Human Village to stock it when this is all done.

... I should think not on this much longer.

The being isn't visible from here.
The fog... it's denser than it should be.
Why do I feel a familiarity with it?
... Is my mania coming back around?
... I should think not on this much longer.
[ALICE looks at the photos on the wall]
I am always feeling melancholy when I look at these.
But why do I have them up?
It has always felt the proper thing to do, I suppose.
The answer we're looking for lies not here.
[ALICE looks at the table and chairs]
I have ate not at this table in weeks.
It's such a nice table though.
It brings me a small happiness.
Makes this feel like a home.
... Though... Will I ever be truly home?
A place to escape to when the world brings the sadness out.
I wish someday to share these, but they're all in my native tongue.
... What a burden to have to hold.
This one in particular... it gives me heart. Not that I can use it at present. Dacă aș putea...
[SCENE: Outside Marisa's house, near the bridge]
What's takin' that girl so long?
Ugh, I'm so bored waiting. Might as well see what I can find.
[MARISA sees the flower box in front of her]
I know it's autumn, so the plants are startin' ta wither, but I think these were doomed well before then...
[WHEN FINDING A BARREL WITH NO ROPE]
[WHEN FINDING A BARREL WITH A SQUIRREL]

That's two of 'em! Should be enough...
My arms are still tired from chopping wood the other day, but it can't be helped, ze.
AFTER GETTING AXE EQUIPPED: Marisa faces a tree.
Yer sacrifice is for a noble cause, brother oak.
Great! That should be enough ta repair the bridge. Hope Alice is doing all right on her own like that...
I've got wood for days! Ahaha.
I suppose I have my tools.
I did find some rope. That should help.
Ce minunat! Could you throw it all over here, please?

... I guess it can't be helped.
